meanings.definition: To remove an obstruction or barrier from (something)
meanings.sent1: She was unblocking the sink by clearing out the clog with a plunger.
meanings.sent2: The plumber was unblocking the drain to allow the water to flow freely.
meanings.sent3: After unblocking the path, the hikers were finally able to continue their journey.
meanings.sent4: His apology acted as a key, unblocking the communication between them.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays unblocking the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: The act of making (something) no longer blocked or obstructed
meanings.sent1: The unblocking of the road after the landslide was a relief for the commuters.
meanings.sent2: The unblocking of the pipe was necessary to prevent any further damage.
meanings.sent3: The unblocking of the jammed printer caused a wave of cheers in the office.
meanings.sent4: The unblocking of the logjam in negotiations led to a successful agreement.
meanings.sent5: The unblocking of the dam unleashed a rush of water downstream.
